meanings.definition: The period between childhood and adulthood.
meanings.sent1: During their youths, children start to become more independent.
meanings.sent2: The youths in the neighborhood often play basketball together after school.
meanings.sent3: The youths decided to have a race to see who could eat the most ice cream cones.
meanings.sent4: The energy of the youths was like a river flowing swiftly towards the ocean of maturity.
meanings.sent5: In the youths of life, every day is an adventure waiting to be explored.

meanings.sent1: The youths at the park were laughing and chatting happily.
meanings.sent2: The community center organized a workshop for the local youths.
meanings.sent3: The youths all pitched in to help clean up the park after the event.
meanings.sent4: The youths swarmed the ice cream truck like bees to a flower.
meanings.sent5: The future of the town rested in the hands of its youths.

meanings.sent1: The youths were excited to go camping in the woods.
meanings.sent2: The youths were playing soccer in the field behind the school.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous youths decided to prank their teacher by hiding all the chalk.
meanings.sent4: The youths' laughter echoed through the empty streets at night.
meanings.sent5: The youths' determination to succeed was evident in their hard work.
